ai.summary: The Neptune Health Park Walk is a 14-kilometre moderate hike in the UK, following a circular route through urban parkland and green spaces with varied scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly well-maintained pavements and compact gravel paths, with occasional grassy or boardwalk sections and a few gentle rises. Expect uneven patches near park features such as streams or gardens.
ai.safety_notes: Total distance is 14 km. Check the weather forecast and wear sturdy, waterproof footwear. Bring water, sun protection, and a light layer for changing conditions. Stay on marked trails, yield to other park users, and keep a charged phone with emergency contacts. If walking alone, share your plan and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes with good grip
Phone with charged battery and emergency contact
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are ideal for mild temperatures and moderate crowds; summer offers longer daylight, while winter can be chilly and surfaces slippery.

seo.title: Neptune Health Park Walk - 14 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Neptune Health Park Walk, a 14-kilometre moderate hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and gear for a comfortable day on parkland trails.
